website_summaries.verdict: Simple and easy to use, the silicone edge helps trap the hair before it hits your drain.
pros: Made from silicone and stainless steel
Doesn't get grungy or dirty as quickly as others on the market
Does a good job of staying put once placed over the drain
cons: This drain protector might block so much hair that you have to remove the hair before your water will fully drain from your shower

customer_reviews.title: No more ‘hair spiders’
customer_reviews.text: Love this! It shaved at least 10 minuntes off my already-too-long showers. No more pulling my hairs off my hand one by one and swirling them into a ‘hair spider’ in the shower wall. Note: to keep it in place, step on it to make it concave, otherwise, it will move.
customer_reviews.author: michelle e.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: * great material, do not rust at all * very effective, grasp all hair * perfect fit, 4.5” diameter fits all standard shower drain Cons: * none I love this little thing, it does what it says; and it is made with good material, so far we have used it for months and it didn’t rust at all. The silicon edge prevents it from slipping around in the shower. It is a little bit pricy, but it’s better than all the old hair catchers we had. I would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kris S.

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! I like the way that it looks and it seems to catch a bit of hair. It actually fits over my square drain pretty well and doesn’t budge.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie Arroz

customer_reviews.title: great cheap catcher for non-tub showers.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my shower. PRO: -catches hair really well. I was skeptical but, confirmed. -inexpensive. -basically the same as a product from OXO. -Would probably work great for a kitchen sink too, dunno why you would use it that way. CON: -not already included with most regular showers? -won't work great for a bathtub? -bad choice for a bathroom sink? -Honestly, there are no cons.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen MahanesTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for catching my long, curly hair!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my walk in shower for my long, curly waist-long hair and it's worked perfectly so far! As you can see from the photo, it catches a large amount every time. It's easy to clean, and stays in place most of the time, unless it gets accidently kicked. Very sleek looking, effective drain cover!
customer_reviews.author: Briana

customer_reviews.title: Does its job well!
customer_reviews.text: I shed like I was a hairy cat in a previous life every time I shower so I am very happy to have found and brought this shower drain! I choose it due to the high customer reviews. It is a great drain protect that does it's job well - it easily traps hair without causing a backup of water. I've not had any problems with the water draining slower after using this drain. I also haven't had to clean my drain with strong anti-clogging chemicals for years since I've used this!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: If you are actually looking to prevent a clogged drain this is not a product I would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has long hair (past her shoulders) while my husband and I both have short hair. These hair catchers have been in each shower for over a week now and have "caught" a sum total of ZERO hairs. It looks nice & stays in place well but if you are actually looking to prevent a clogged drain this is not a product I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: minpin256

customer_reviews.title: keeps hair from going down the shower drain...BUT...
customer_reviews.text: The only problem is drain is very slow from suds from shampoo & body wash. I have to remove the hair 1st from the LEKEYE shower drain & remove it so my shower drain can drain properly. I have long hair & want to keep it from causing pipe blockage.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny Von Tepperoff

customer_reviews.title: I've tried three different drain protectors this is the best. It grabs hair and holds onto it on ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried three different drain protectors this is the best. It grabs hair and holds onto it on the outside. Nothing gets through this one. I have really thick long hair and have clogged every pipe in every house we have ever lived in. My plumbing bills have been through the roof, if i had only found this little contraption earlier.
customer_reviews.author: moneypenny

customer_reviews.title: Great after one minor modification
customer_reviews.text: This keeps the hair out of the drain when it's in place. To solve the "in place" problem, I used the existing drain screw. I had to drill a small hole in the lekeye cover so the screw could pass through it and hold everything down. It works great for my shower. No more movement and no more hair down the drain. The only drawback to the modification is you have to take the screw out to clean. That is worth it to me.
customer_reviews.author: YoBro

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Catch The Hair
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work for me, I threw it away. It just didn't catch any hair (after trying for a few weeks)! Others complained that it blocks the water flow, and sometimes it did--but easily fixed by just turning it or adjusting it so the water flows better. Of course, maybe that's why it then didn't catch any hair.
customer_reviews.author: G. Welton

customer_reviews.title: Not for all showers
customer_reviews.text: Bought this based on the great reviews. Unfortunately, it would not stay in place in my tub and let the hair go down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: True Savvy

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and it Works!
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of variations on this product over the years, and this is my favorite. The plastic ones rip, the silicone ones stain and curl, and this one will not do either! I love that it is flat. I have a drain in the middle of my large shower stall, so the flat feature is amazing, and hard to find that really works. Since it doesn't get "creepy" like other materials, my kids are more likely to pick up the hair it catches. I cannot say enough good about this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of Four

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This works great! I had an old white rubber kind and it didn't fit over the shower drain (standup shower only) This fits perfect, blocks the hair and looks great because it looks like the drain itself. I did step on it by accident and it was inverted but still blocked hair. I just bent down and pushed it back with my thumb and it popped back to normal. I love this though. Glad I bought it. Just have to make sure I don't step on it in the middle.
customer_reviews.author: Nayma

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit to save my shower drain
customer_reviews.text: After a $400 plumber's bill (I know, yikes!!! 😱😱😱) I decided to buy a hair catch for our shower. We have a stall style shower so I had no luck finding good options at the store, but this fits perfectly over our drain. It catches so much hair and it's easy to clean (you pick the hair off the surface and toss it). The only con I can think of is that it doesn't latch on the drain in any way, it just lays on top of it, so you could scoot it with your foot if you step on the drain while showering.
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Very effective and not an eyesore!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this drain protector! It doesn't look as junky as the plastic ones and I like the fact that it lays flat and doesn't get kicked out of the way. It does a great job of keeping hair out of the drain! The silicone around the edges does seem to keep it in place.
customer_reviews.author: Coastal Grammie

customer_reviews.title: Moves around
customer_reviews.text: I used it for little over a week now. It doesn't stick to the surface and moves around but still holds onto the hair from getting into the drain. I might need to get some clear silicon sealant to glue it to the tiles. Will update soon on how that turns out. UPDATE: The holes are too small and the water doesn't drain at all. I have to move this out of the drain so the soap water eventually drains off. Do not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: kuttan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work. It didn’t stop hair from going down the drain and it doesn’t stay in place. Hair would just go under the cover.
customer_reviews.author: Scubagirlok

customer_reviews.title: Unfortunately this just did not work for us. It ...
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this just did not work for us. It only caught hair that fell directly on top of it--all of the other hair was able to go underneath and down the drain even though it was sitting flat. We tried turning it around and it didn't matter which side we used, it just never really caught anything. We wanted a stainless steel one so that it wouldn't mold but since it doesn't catch anything, we've had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Xueying Han

customer_reviews.title: Did not work with my tiled shower drain
customer_reviews.text: This item was useless in my tiled shower. It is a good bit larger than the drain cover and would not stay in place in my tiled shower. Water ran underneath and it did not trap any hair.
customer_reviews.author: kjones9820

customer_reviews.title: Well made, but slows down draining too much for us
customer_reviews.text: This was near perfect solution for us. We have shower stall with loose drain cover with fairly large holes. This fit perfectly over it and held both in place. But with both covers in place, water drained too slow and base of shower stall fills up with water. The original cover, while loose, more or less stays in place. If I remove the original and only use the LEKEYE Shower Hair Catcher Drain Protector by itself, water drains sufficiently fast, but it moves about too easily, and slides off to expose an open drain pipe. If I could get it to stay in place, it would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: OnTheFarm

customer_reviews.title: Why Did I Wait So Long to Buy This?
customer_reviews.text: We recently had our shower fixture replaced and I started to notice a strong mold smell. Our bathroom is cleaned regularly. We were worried that we had a leak behind the tile. One day, my foot got stuck to the shower drain cover and lifted it. To my surprise, the pipe was filled with hair, gook, and mold. I removed a ton of hair and flushed the pipe with bleach and water, multiple times. The pipe was then clean. To prevent this from reoccurring, I purchased the Lekeye. It is perfect! After showering, I remove hair sitting on top with a tissue and dispose it. Our bathroom smells fresh again. I wish I bought this years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Works Really Well
customer_reviews.text: I have long fine hair, and even if I try to get all the hair off my shower floor, some get sucked into the drain and recently caused drainage to slow. I was able to clear the clog but decided to try a hair catcher as preventive maintenance. This item does the job and is aesthetically pleasing as well. It fits perfectly on top of the circular drain in my shower and stays put. The hair gathers on top of it and doesn't seem to be escaping underneath despite having no suction. The silicone rim keeps it in place. Really happy with my purchase and hope it keeps my shower clog free.
customer_reviews.author: RS79

customer_reviews.title: Works Like a Charm!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great drain hair catcher! It works as hoped and anticipated. The rubber lining around the edge is really critical and needed to keep it in place, especially if you have a shower/tub combo like me. It stays in place even if a strong stream is hitting it - perfect! It’s getting the job done..no more hair down the 1950s drain. I’d definitely buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Bay Park Girl

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: This item fit perfectly over my shower drain. It looks as if it was made on it. It woks so much better than the plastic drain catcher I purchased from Bed Bath and Beyond. It stayed in place and did not allow hair to pass through. It did not impede water drainage and was not hard to clean. I am very impressed with it. I threw the plastic one away immediately after my first use of this one.
customer_reviews.author: Ms T

customer_reviews.title: Just did not work for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I hate to give such a low rating here but it did not work for any of the three tubs/showers I purchased for. It catches little to no hair, whether it's convex or concave. It looks easy to clean and sturdy, so maybe it will work well for people with a different set-up.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: It works!!
customer_reviews.text: After we removed a hair clog that was the size of a chihuahua from the show drain, we decided that we needed some extra help filtering out the hair that was going down the drain. After researching various options, this hair catcher seemed like the best (and most attractive) option. It just sits on top of the shower drain and the silicone rim helps seal it so that the water flows over the top, where the hair is "caught" and prevented from creating small gunky creatures in the pipes. It will slide around if you kick it, but still does the job. I am removing small amounts of hair after every shower. I am pleased with it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline M. Butts

customer_reviews.title: Not for tile
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really work for tile. It goes over the drain but doesn’t create a proper seal (whether it is stomped on to make it concave or otherwise) so some hair does get trapped on top as advertised but the rest slides between the tile cracks under the stopper and gets stuck in the drain which is what I am trying to avoid. I have really small tile and the grout lines are thin but I think this only works for certain types of showers. Maybe if the rubber were shaped differently it would work better. It looks well made though.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay in place
customer_reviews.text: It's better than using no hair catcher at all, but overall I'm disappointed in it's performance. I expected the silicone edges to hold it in place. Instead, it's very easy to accidentally nudge out of place because it doesn't grip the floor and then doesn't catch the hair when it's not centered over the drain. It's also hard to tell which side is up and if it's placed upside down it doesn't catch hair at all. One positive: it only traps hair, not soap film and other small particles, so it's very easy to clean. I had hoped for better from all the good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Chaikin

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for flat drains
customer_reviews.text: My apartment doesn't have a dipped drain; it's just a flat drain so I was forced to find a flat hair trap. This product functions exactly as advertised and I couldn't be happier. The silicone edge prevents slippage so even if I accidentally drag my feet while showering it won't budge much. I have to actually bend down and pick up the catcher if I want to remove it. It traps hair well and even leaves it in a very clean well that slides off. Haven't had any issues with hair getting tangled yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and effective
customer_reviews.text: Best hair trap product I’ve used. Fits well over shower drain and easy to clean. Slight concave profile so the trap can be used with either the concave side up or down depending on how it fits better for your situation. Looks like it will be very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: To get it to collect anything, I had to pop it inward to make it concave. This way it has a little dip. In either position, it does not slide around unless I bump it off. The does well with the water. It collects some hair, but some still slips underneath or just perfectly in the hole and gets slurped down. It’s better to catch some than to let it all go down, and it’s better than losing a shroom down the pipe.
customer_reviews.author: S Coyle

customer_reviews.title: Good deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Our shower drain is a large 5" round, installed crookedly over uneven 2" tiles. Finding a drain cover large enough pretty much limited us to the LEYEYE. It fits OK, but will not suction down because of our weird shower. However, it does catch hair around the edges, so seems to stop a lot of the hair that would normally go down our drain. I think it works as good as anything I could see on the market as most would not fit at all. If the shower were even, it would be great!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Lin

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was a little disappointed because it seems to be too big. Actually, it works great. I did the step on it to make it concave to keep it from moving and it works fine. I wish fit a little bit more, and it causes a small level of standing water during a shower from the seal on the sides. It has no trouble draining and works great. I knew I lose a lot of hair in the drain, but wow, so much. It's scary. Everyone once in a while I bump it and get concerned since it moved a little, but so far after 2 weeks, it's working great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hawley

customer_reviews.title: Works well for slate shower
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my shower which has a slate floor with flat drain. The only annoying thing is that the idiot who designed my shower placed the drain right in the middle so my feet inevitably knock the drain cover off of the drain as I'm moving around in the shower, but considering that, it works batter than anything else on catching the majority of my very long hair.
customer_reviews.author: Miamigirl2018

customer_reviews.title: Drain Saver.
customer_reviews.text: Drain Saver. We have two girls the house that shed.. A LOT. The large surface area reduces how often I have to clean hair from the drain and not have the speed that water drains being affected. It remains put and does not move or float around. This is replacing the one I bought 2 years ago because it was getting a bit nasty and I didn't feel like cleaning it. But I haven't had to declog a drain since the first purchase. Will keep on buying this item.
customer_reviews.author: Eric1916

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This item is made great! You just place it over your drain, and it stays in place. We have girls in the family with long hair, and it's caught all the hair. I removed the drain catcher to see if there was any hair in my drain, and I didn't see any. So this product is doing it job.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy C.

customer_reviews.title: Good drain cover/hair catcher
customer_reviews.text: Good cover/hair catcher for a shower drain. This is before and after photos. Rebath replaced the whole shower and that was their drain that they installed, pretty gross if you ask me. No way of cleaning it unless you unscrew the whole thing which is ridiculous, so this was a solution for now. At least I know it will catch the hair and I like how it has some weight to it. It sits right inside the drain enclosure over the existing drain cover and doesn't move. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean but slides around
customer_reviews.text: For $10 this drain isn't too bad. It does move around sometimes if the water pressure is high enough, but it's WAYYYY easier to clean than the last few plastic/silicone hair catchers I purchased. Some reviews said that this doesn't lay flat, but it lays flat in my tub since it dips down slightly where the drain is. All in all I'd purchase again. But I'd recommend the company install a plastic/rubber lining underneath to keep the stopper in place.
customer_reviews.author: D. SHORE

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my husband who dealt with my hair clogging our shower!
customer_reviews.text: Husband and I darn near put draino on subscribe and save to get my long Chewbacca hairs out of our annoying drain, which inevitably turned our standing shower into 2 inches of tub and overflow in a 20 minute wash. First shower I put it in and it fit PERFECTLY on our drain. After my shower, I had a ton of long hair on it, picked it right up and threw it away. The catcher seamlessly caught my hair without causing any kind of backup. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Anastacia

customer_reviews.title: Good hair catcher!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this hair catcher for the bathtub/shower drain because my wife's hair wreaks havoc in our drains. This hair catcher works great, and fits nicely over the drain. It has thin rubber edges underneath which help to keep it from sliding. Well worth the money, and catches my wife's hair before it gets down the drain, so I haven't had to call the plumber for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Works very well!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked that this product works so well. I have long thick hair that has been clogging the shower drain for months. I had been using a ridiculous amount of Drano to help push the hair down the drain but I needed a better solution. I live in a condo so I could not make any permanent changes to the drain. This was a very cheap, very easy solution to the problem. Works well, catches my hair before it goes into the drain, easy to remove and clean. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: AndiRea

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but still allows a lot of hair to slip around base seal.
customer_reviews.text: Works OK. I got it after clearing numerous hair clogs from one of our showers. The screen covers the drain with about 1/8th of an inch to spare. It is easily knocked out of place, and allows for hair to bypass the screen's base seal. If there were some sort of piece that slotted down into the drain it would keep it from shifting, but I suppose that would make it less "universal". All said, it definitely helps catch *some* of the hair, but I wouldn't rely on it to catch most of it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and catches hair...
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice looking drain cover that does an excellent job of catching hair. What I didn’t like was that it would not stay in place - even though it measured the same diameter as my previous plastic drain cover. It slipped all over the place every time it was touched. However, I found a solution. I bought 4 stainless steel machine screws (6x5/8) that I screwed into the holes in the drain cover that corresponded to the inside diameter of my drain. This makes the cover very snug and looks good too. See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T.

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says! Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I am sorry happy I found this on your website as it’s been a game changer for me! As most people I wanted to catch the hair after I wash so it wouldn’t clog my bathroom drain in the tub! I had another brand that you are supposed to screw in the drain (it was a pain, as sometimes it would stay in but most times it would come out!) After receiving this it is amazing! It stays in place and all you do is wipe the hair and. throw it away! I loved it so much, I have ordered a second one!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to use and really works!!
customer_reviews.text: I have spent a small fortune trying to find a drain cover that will REALLY catch hair as it claims. Well I now have it! This shower drain hair catcher works. It does not suction and is not designed to. It sits firmly over your drain. It has a ridge of rubber to help it from slipping. I have been using it for a couple of months and have stopped my search for drain cover hair catcher. This is the one for me. It simply sits over your drain and is easy to wipe clean. Seems to be catching all the hair of the 3 long haired females in our house. Hooray, no more Liquid Plumber!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hope it was heavier quality stainless portion.
customer_reviews.text: Seems to cling to bath tube base and catches hair better than the previous stainless hair catcher I had. Only wish I have is that the stainless was heavier quality stainless than it is so it stays put instead it floats briefly when I turn on water on the faucet before changing it to shower.
customer_reviews.author: Arirangfan

customer_reviews.title: Did not catch hair.
customer_reviews.text: Just didn't work. Could be the way our shower floor is but regardless did not work.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: It's Great!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I bought it for the dog hair when we bathe them in shower but it's catching our hair too. Doesn't move around (until a dog gets it!) It even looks better than the drain cover. Win/Win!
customer_reviews.author: camimac

customer_reviews.title: Essential for tracking the efficacy of hair-loss products and regimens
customer_reviews.text: I got this product specifically so I could count and track exactly how many hairs I am losing per day when beginning new hair-loss regimens. If you're trying new products for hair loss then honestly a good shower hair catcher is essential for tracking whether or not new medications and products are actually doing anything for your hair loss or not. As an added bonus this product looks great. It looks much better and higher quality than the drain that came with my shower.
customer_reviews.author: Garrett

customer_reviews.title: Durable, simple, and gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: While I was reading all the ShowerShroom reviews (boy, was I glad I read those! Nothing worse than having to call a plumber to dismantle your piping because a flimsy device fell down into it!), a reviewer suggested this shower drain protector as a better alternative. This thing is stainless steel, rust-proof, and perfectly fits the drain of my 1963 soapstone walk-in shower. No chance of this device slipping through my plumbing! After each shower, I bend down and gather whatever the drain protector has caught - and toss it in the trash bin. So simple & no worrying about my plumbing! Truth in advertising is what you get with this device.
customer_reviews.author: TechGirl

customer_reviews.title: Only works on completely flat surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this to work. It looks good in the shower, its sturdy, and it would be very easy to take hair off of it. Unfortunately, my shower slopes down toward the middle and because of this and ever so slight unevenness in the tile, hair slips underneath this hair catcher instead of catching and sitting on the top. The lip is also large, so any hair that did get caught stuck on the edge instead of washing onto the top. If your shower is flat and has totally smooth tile, this will probably work fine. But it there is any unevenness or sloping toward the drain, this will most likely do very little to catch hair.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my shower stall. So far, stays in place and collects hair. Looks very nice. I have a one piece gel coat shower, and I suspect it works better on that than it would on tile. Plus the area around my drain - 6" circle or so - is recessed slightly, and I think that might also help. Only sharing those thoughts because I see reviews that said it didn't stay in place. My guess is that they have a tile shower with a flush drain. But it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: ChristyAnn

customer_reviews.title: Correct positioning of the cover is essential.
customer_reviews.text: I used it in our shower drain to catch my long hair. I was disappointed the first time I used it. The ratings had been good. The next day I looked at it and realized I had put it on the drain the wrong way! You need to look at your drain and figure out the best direction to place it on the drain. I reversed the cover the next day and it worked great ! It worked best for me when it was placed with the slight “ point” downward. ( there were no directions with it )
customer_reviews.author: sandra

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I always read the 1 star comments before making a purchase, and there were some people complaining about this product sliding around or causing water to pool around it. After using it for a week, we've had no such problem. It's true that it's firmly attached to the floor, and if you're dancing in the shower, it may be easy to move it. That said, I don't know anyone that stands directly on the drain, and there is enough friction on the edge that water alone will not move it. So, it's very convenient, stays in place, easy to clean, and most importantly it traps hair before it can go down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Works all right
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for a few months in our shower. It doesn’t move out of place over the drain that I’ve noticed, but it definitely doesn’t suction into place. I’m not confident that it’s catching all the hair though, as I’ve found some hair on top of/going into the drain beneath it. I think a filter that sits inside the drain would be more efficient. I could see it working well in a kitchen sink though if we needed it for that.
customer_reviews.author: JRAD

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: At first I was put off at the price of this item for what it is but after looking around and only finding cheap plastic options I decided to go ahead and order. I am sure glad that I did as this drain cover is worth the price. I no longer worry about hair clogging my bathroom drain and this cover let's none through. It looks nice and the rubber around the edge makes it stay in place. I plan on ordering one for my other bathroom and two to try at my kitchen sinks as I think this would work great for keeping food out of drains.
customer_reviews.author: Brit

customer_reviews.title: Attractive, Well made Shower Drain Strainer
customer_reviews.text: We just had a new shower installed and wanted a hair strainer to prevent clogged drains. We bought this hair strainer because it blended well with the colors in our shower and based on the positive reviews. So far it works very well. The only issue is that it doesn't have any suction so it moves when your feet hit it - which is not a big deal for us. Overall we've been happy with the purchase and plan on keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Lross

customer_reviews.title: Good info
customer_reviews.text: When I got this, I put it in and as soon as I turned on the shower, it scooted away from the drain. But then I remembered a review I read on her before buying this! The reviewer said that if it didn't fit one way, turn it over, it fit like a dream. Then the reviewer said to step down in the middle of it. I put my heel on it and stepped down and *pop* it went concave and now the water drains perfectly, the hair catches like in a little cup and I am SO pleased with it!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: While my boyfriend is bald, I on the other hand shed worse than a dog. So I needed to buy something to catch all my hair from going down his drain. Hopped on amazon and it looked like this one had good reviews. It definitely did not disappoint. Catches all my hair and is super easy to clean. The suction is the only thing that I can’t rate 5 stars. At first it seemed to stick to the bottom of the shower pretty well, but as time goes on I noticed that it moves around a lot more, but it is not completely terrible. Would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alisha

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job catching the hair
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t suction cup onto your drain. It sits on top but it’s the perfect size for my shower and seems to do a great job catching all the hair. It’s even caught the fine hair from my Yorkie when I give him a shower too. The collected hair you just grab and it is easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Gina

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased when a product does just what it advertises it does!
customer_reviews.text: The drain in my shower has large spacing, excellent for water draining but I kept thinking it's just a matter of time until I plug the drain with my long hair! So I proactively purchased this hair catcher and it works excellently! Very pleased when a product does just what it advertises it does! Simply place it on top of drain, take a shower, clean the drain of hair when finished. Comes off fast and easy, no pulling or yanking. It's great!
customer_reviews.author: GloriaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: This works just as it should. However, it has no suction. You put it over your shower drain and it will catch hair. I make sure not to touch it until I turn the water off and then take the hair catcher out of the shower to remove the hair. Make sure you have no standing water because it would not stay put and would float around. I would give it 5 Stars if it had good suction.
customer_reviews.author: Dina87

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It definitely catches some hair, but not ALL, so it does not work.
customer_reviews.author: XQ1242-A

customer_reviews.title: Well made and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like this product very much and think it's reasonably priced for the quality. I needed an additional filter to catch the hair before going down my shower drain and this strainer works very well. It has a bit of weight to it so pretty much stays in place and the silicone helps with that too. I did step on it when I first put it in to help make a better seal. It's very easy to clean and doesn't rust. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a sturdy strainer for their walk-in shower drain.
customer_reviews.author: Catmama

customer_reviews.title: Gr
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this thing! I have such long hair that literally falls out everywhere that my boyfriend and I thought this would be a great purchase for our shower. It definitely picks up every hair (and I have very fine hair) and is definitely easy to remove and clean. My only gripe with it is that it's easily moved by our feet when we're in the shower, but we just try to keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: hannahtheham

customer_reviews.title: Effective, good quality product.
customer_reviews.text: This is the only shower drain cover I've found that actually stops the hair from going down without backing up the water! Great product. It stays in place fairly well! And is still easy to remove and clean! I liked it enough to get another for our other shower! Seems like a really good quality product! I have noticed that it's out of place when I go to shower, but never comes up when I'm showering!
customer_reviews.author: Mgian

customer_reviews.title: Keeps hair OUT!
customer_reviews.text: Used a similar product by OXO in my son's bathroom to catch his long hair and beard and it worked great. When I got a big clog from my hair in my bathroom, I knew it was time to get one of these haircatchers for the floor drain in my shower. This is the right size and thanks to the silicone edge it doesn't slide around. Very well made -- should last many, many years and save me a LOT of aggravation!
customer_reviews.author: HMB

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what it’s supposed to do, get this one
customer_reviews.text: Working great so far, have had it for about a month. I love that it completely covers the drain and it looks nice like it belongs there. Gets all the hair and easy to clean. The only thing that could improve is that if you accidentally move it with your feet, it will move out of place. No big deal, I just slide it back into place. I haven’t had to clean it with soap yet because it still looks shiny and brand new. No mildew build up yet, so that’s promising.
customer_reviews.author: dra

customer_reviews.title: Solid materials, works as intended
customer_reviews.text: It catches hair, which is the reason I bought it. It's not a permanent solution so it will move if I accidentally touch it as I shower, but only slightly. The rubber ring underneath holds it well in place. Water alone doesn't move it. It's been stepped on a few times, which causes it to become inverted. I can pop it back and it doesn't seem to cause any damage. Sturdy product
customer_reviews.author: Luis M.

customer_reviews.title: I am frustrated!
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t function at all. It doesn’t stuck on place, the hair goes under it easily. Doesn’t worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Olga

customer_reviews.title: Actually stops hair from going down the drain.
customer_reviews.text: My wife has clogged every drain in our bathrooms with hair balls. I bought this product in a disperate attempt to stop the plumber bills. The drain cover has worked very well and well beyond my expectations. I remove a small ball of hair from the top of it every 2 or 3 times I shower. The drain has remained clean and free flowing. I will need to use this product for a while to see if the drain clogs are really gone, but so far the results are great.
customer_reviews.author: Blues Guy in Philly

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars all around
customer_reviews.text: I liked the stainless steel hair catchers and these fit in both the bathtub and shower stall. The silicone does a good job in conforming to the surfaces and not allowing hair to enter the drain. Wish I had these years ago.
customer_reviews.author: steve l

customer_reviews.title: Wife, daughter and long hair cat but I'm bald
customer_reviews.text: Hair everywhere! Wife and daughter blessed with natural thick, long red hair. Tried other drain filters but most prone to mildew thus yucky to clean. One week after receipt, these gizmos appear to be catching the hair in two drains. OK so far. This product is offered in a set of two reducing the price approximately $5.00. Don't be stupid like me and buy two at regular price. I'd buy them again. Happy bathing!
customer_reviews.author: KenW

customer_reviews.title: One of the best things I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Solved my shower drain issues. I live with three women who all have long hair. My hair also sheds a lot although it's not nearly as long. I was having to put drano or snake my shower drain once a month before buying this. Now I just pick this up every few days and throw the hair in the garbage. Looks great too!
customer_reviews.author: Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Like a new drain without the hassle.
customer_reviews.text: It does exactly what it is supposed to. My shower drain has huge holes and I have longish hair. It is really difficult to clean out the little catch under the grate. This cover fits over the existing drain without seeming too high or big. I haven't had any problem with it moving or shifting. It's caught the hair nicely, and it's easy to just pick it up and clean it off. No fishing down the drain with one of those zip things.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: They are as great as they look
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a plastic catcher that had finer holes that was aging. I was skeptical not by it's design, which I like a LOT, but more by the size of the holes. Would they really prevent hair from passing through? The answer is YES! The way everything floats and collects on top of this strainer makes it very easy to clean up. I've also checked my drain where it normally clogs and there's nothing there. Very effective. I'm a believer!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Warner

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This one fits INTO our shower drain. Until I find a replacement for the [anonymous] drain cover that rested OVER the drain this one it certainly up the task. It's not rocket science, but what a nice thought that a manufacturer would place their name on their product. The folks who made this item do, and I do not take it lightly...
customer_reviews.author: M. RUSSO

customer_reviews.title: Catches hair and easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Best shower hair catcher that currently exist. This is our third attempt to purchase an effective hair catcher, and we found it! This is super easy to clean, and does catch all hair. Suggestion: works best with showers with a handle, tends to flood if water falls directly on the catcher. Con: It stays in place, but very easy to move if you accidentally kick it while showering
customer_reviews.author: Tansil

customer_reviews.title: Great hair catcher
customer_reviews.text: This hair catcher fit my shower drain perfectly and does catch hair. Note: this is a perfectly flat hair catcher - it must be placed on a flat surface otherwise it will not function properly
customer_reviews.author: ShoreD

customer_reviews.title: Works decently well for my tub drain
customer_reviews.text: Meh... I'd say it catches 80% of the hair that would otherwise go down the drain if this hair catcher weren't there. 80% is better than 0% so I'm still giving it 3 stars. I did read in other reviews that it appeared to work better in shower drains than tub drains so it could be that my drain just isn't the right fit for this device.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so simple you'd think it wouldn't work. I was certainly skeptical but color me surprised, because it works very well. Previously I used one of those drop-in screens with a dip in them to keep my numerous fine hairs from clogging the drain, but the shower at my new place won't take one, so I tried this. Lo, it catches and holds my super-fine hairs on top. And it's easy to clean -- just wipe with a bit of toilet paper. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: R. Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Really does catch the hair.
customer_reviews.text: It really DOES catch the hair. The aggravating issue is that it is in the middle of my shower, so you have to be careful not to move it with your foot while showering. My husband is kinda bald, so he puts it on the side when he showers, and I put it back in place when I shower. Not a big deal at all. It's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Meesh

customer_reviews.title: So so product
customer_reviews.text: It was nice finding a flat hair catcher for my shower drain however, didn’t catch all the hair because the ends doesn’t stick to the shower floor. Suppose something is better than nothing
customer_reviews.author: Dervan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't suction to my drain (stand up shower) but its the only one that I found that fit the diameter. It keeps most of the hair from going down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: Angie Harding

customer_reviews.title: Slides out of place
customer_reviews.text: A well made passive drain cover, with small holes to catch hair, but it does not stay in place. Maybe it would be ok in some circumstances, but in the center of a shower stall isn’t one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty dang well avoiding hairballs down the drain
customer_reviews.text: Argh, before this I was dragging small piles of hair out of my drain. Now some would say, Sir who the hell is showering in your home and why is all their hair falling out? Well, my Wife’s hair is thick and beautiful so I cannot complain about the hair in drain, but this takes all the worry away that we will have a septic back up from all the clogging. Buy this and enjoy the piece of mind...
customer_reviews.author: AMM

customer_reviews.title: Settled right into its spot in 2 seconds, and stayed there
customer_reviews.text: I love that this sits directly in our shower drain and does not move, despite not having to be screwed in anywhere -- especially because the screws where our original drain cover was got broken, so we have nothing to screw into. But I just set this in place, stepped on it, and the center popped down a small amount, holding it in place. It looks a lot better than the basket-type drain cover we had there before. This was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Gold

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work in my tub drain.
customer_reviews.text: The diameter of this hair catcher is just barely wider than my tub drain, about 1/16th inch to spare. Some hair gets through under the silicone edge. And the tiny holes prevent the water from draining quickly. This product will maybe work with a different type of drain, but not for mine.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT C. KEAULANI

customer_reviews.title: inflexible in very curved tub
customer_reviews.text: Working mostly okay so far. The drain in the tub we are using this in is very close to the edge of the tub, so the cover is not centered. The inflexibility of the cover and the amount of the extended curve at the drain end of the tub doesn't allow it to sit completely flat while over the drain. It still seems to catch most of the hair so we'll see if the amount going down is minor enough to avoid more clogs.
customer_reviews.author: Red in a brunette world

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work For Me
customer_reviews.text: I used this with a square drain hoping it would work since it's much larger then the drain and the rim would make contact all around floor of the shower unfortunately it had no grip and constantly moved around might be suited better for a drain that is not in the center of shower where your feet are.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley McCann Apostle

customer_reviews.title: Hair slipped underneath
customer_reviews.text: Our shower floor slopes dramatically into the drain and initially I thought this would work well since it seemed to fit nicely into the space above the existing drain cover. However, there were enough gaps around the edges due to uneven tile work that most of the hair slipped under this rather than being washed onto it. Bummer! The quality and appearance are really nice but functionally it didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: It sort of gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of hair, which means a lot of hair down the drain. I ordered this thinking it would be a great way to catch the hair so it doesn't clog up the drain. It is very flimsy and seems to do a somewhat decent job. If there's some shower water that sprays in the direction of the drain protector, it moves so a lot of hair will escape down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: JCheng

customer_reviews.title: ... did not expect much from this but it was PERFECT. I have waist-length fine hair and a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I did not expect much from this but it was PERFECT. I have waist-length fine hair and a lot of it, as well as a roll-in shower with a large drain. I expected this item to shift off of the floor but it stays perfectly in place due to the silicone edge, and I can very easily gather up my hair and throw it out, and it doesn't go down my drain at all.
customer_reviews.author: Fobetta Ophowerse

customer_reviews.title: The details are right on
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter's shower. She sheds, well actually is too lazy to pick up her hair in the shower. Anyways, I bought this and it fits so good over the drain. Absolutely NO hair is going down the drain anymore. It's nice to look at too. It looks like it's a part of the tub.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: No Suction, Does a Fine Job
customer_reviews.text: I've still got a hair catcher under this that catches hairs, but the large hair catcher does the bulk of the work. I've not experienced any suction power at all. I've stepped on this multiple times and it pops in and out, but it doesn't seem to impact its effectiveness.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: It fits my standing shower great. I have no suction though. It doesn't move because the silicon ring does provide some stabilization but it's not a suction. Keeps hair from going down the drain though.
customer_reviews.author: Jiazhong Liu

customer_reviews.title: Good but could be better sized.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what it meant by suction power but since it fits exactly over the shower drain grill it doesn’t have any notable overlap so ergo no suction. This is overall well made but should have been an extra half inch wider so when stepped on in the shower it would less likely move about.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Catches most hair
customer_reviews.text: Since this sits on top of a tiled shower floor, it is not 100% flush with the floor surface (due to the grout lines). SO, that being said, I think some hair escapes down the drain. But overall, it is catching nearly all of the hair. I gave shoulder length hair. But when my hair gets longer, I anticipate more hair being caught.
customer_reviews.author: RealConsumer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: This hair catcher got a ton of good reviews so I was pretty confident buying it but the hair goes right under it. It looks pretty but doesn't work. Perhaps if you have a different type of shower floor, we have small tiles, I don't know but for us it doesn't work and we'll have to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Aharon

product_meta.title: LEKEYE Shower Drain Hair Catcher/Strainer/Stainless Steel and Silicone
feature_bullets: The use of rust-proof stainless steel structure, suitable for the shower drain
Design of elliptical holes, effectively grasp the hair, not blocking the drainage
Intermediate semi-circle design allows smooth drainage
Silicone edge, effectively blocking foreign bodies, drained
Combining silicone rust, proof stainless steel is easy to clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,761 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
